content: Are people still working on making the never type stable, or is that taking a backseat to other things? Is there a dependency that needs to be met?
we have to fix the coercion problems
afaik nobody is actively working on it, but I've been hoping we'll pick it up post Rust 2018
Is there a conceptual direction to fix them, or is it still further away than that? (Don't bother pulling any of this back into memory, these are just high-level curiosity questions)
do you mean "do we know what to do, just haven't had time to do it"?
we're not quite sure how to fix without breaking other things
the "eventual plan" that I think would work is kind of far off, not sure if there is a targeted hack

do you mean "do we know what to do, just haven't had time to do it"?

Yep, that's what I meant. Thank you!
